title: Asylum Case - Referral to an Immigration Court - Can I appeal to court without lawyer?
question: I have done my asylum case interview last Monday, and I am waiting for the result next week. I am just wondering if I get denied by USCIS, and ended up with getting "Referral to an Immigration Court" result, can I appeal to the court without lawyer? I just found my lawyer is not helpful at all, and I don't want to spend my money by hiring a lawyer like that.
question_tags: Immigration,Asylum,Deportation,Immigration court,Deportation appeals,LLC (limited liability company),Bankruptcy,Debt,Debt relief,Bankruptcy and debt,Lawsuits and disputes,Working with a lawyer,Appeals,Court basics
answers:
You need a good immigration lawyer. "Referral to the Immigration Court" means the government wants the Immigration Judge to deny you asylum and deport you. That's serious! It's very possible that the immigration lawyer you have now is not experienced in Immigration Court.

Without a lawyer you are a sitting duck. The government will show you no mercy. While the Immigration Judge is supposed to be impartial, he or she will not guide you through the process to success.

The chances you know enough about the law to succeed are between very low and zero.

Get a lawyer now.

If you are referred to Immigration Court, you should hire an experienced immigration lawyer to help you with the court hearing. The Court Hearing will be a Deportation/Removal Hearing, where USCIS is trying to have the judge order that you be deported to your country of origin.

Yes, you can always choose to represent yourself in Immigration Court. However, it is not advisable to do so. If you are not content with your lawyer's representation, you should hire another attorney to help you. Fighting deportation will be money well spent.

I hope that your asylum petition is approved so that you don't have to deal with any removal issues.

Good luck to you!

Nikiki T. Bogle, Esq.

www.immigrationlegalteam.com

Yes you can but it is more likely the judge will push for you to get a lawyer. Note: I doubt a good lawyer will not be helpful! It is just a matter of finding the right one.

Good Luck
